title: Defaulted on settlement stipulation last year and been paying as agreed but due to financial hardship and this pandemic.
question: I defaulted on a settlement stipulation last year 2020 and I was paying as agreed on time but due to this pandemic and financial hardship , Total owed was only $7500 , with a $315./mo ...I contacted the property and advised them I will delay payments maybe for 1-2 mos only they told me to call back next month but when I called back, they told me that my account was sent to
answers: I agree with my colleague - that you should contact an attorney to assist in this matter. Depending upon your overall financial situation, bankruptcy may be a good path for resolving this and any other debt you have.

It sounds like you need to hire a new attorney to help you settle/renegotiate this or maybe see a bankruptcy attorney. You had an agreement to pay and you head to break the agreement. Sometimes settlement agreements have a penalty built in to increase the amount owed if there is a default.
